docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1.--Prospects for the world's wheat supply, while not so satisfactory as was expected during the first part of the current season, show at present no cause for serious alarm.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1.--Prospects for the world's wheat supply, while not so satisfactory as was expected during the first part of the current season, show at present no cause for serious alarm.

headline.main: WORLD WHEAT CROP ABOVE LAST YEAR'S; Estimates for Twenty Countries, Including United States,Total 2,461,430,000 Bushels.BETTER YIELDS IN EUROPEBut Drought Is Expected to ForceIndia to Import Instead ofExport Grain.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Elihu Root will not be a member of the International Court of Justice. His decision not to sit in the world tribunal constituted under the League of Nations was announced here yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Elihu Root will not be a member of the International Court of Justice. His decision not to sit in the world tribunal constituted under the League of Nations was announced here yesterday.

headline.main: ROOT NOT TO ACCEPT WORLD COURT PLACE; Gives His Age, 76 Years, as the Reason for Refusing Support for Judgeship.DISAPPOINTMENT IN GENEVA John Bassett Moore Backed by Italy in View of Root'sDeclination.

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 2.--The oil conference continues and both sides say they are confident that an arrangement will be made soon.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 2.--The oil conference continues and both sides say they are confident that an arrangement will be made soon.

headline.main: OBREGON PREDICTS AGREEMENT ON OIL; Conferences With American Companies' Representatives Progressing in Mexico City.

byline.original: Copyright, 1921, by The New York Times Company. Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: American-made electric light fixtures have been selling in remarkably increasing quantities in all parts of the world during the last three years, and in 1921 the sales promise to equal in value and to far exceed in volume the sales for 1920,...
docs.lead_paragraph: American-made electric light fixtures have been selling in remarkably increasing quantities in all parts of the world during the last three years, and in 1921 the sales promise to equal in value and to far exceed in volume the sales for 1920, according to Export American Industries, the organ of the National Association of Manufacturers.

headline.main: INCREASE IN EXPORT OF LIGHT FIXTURES; Latin America Buying Heavily, Due to Extension of Electricity.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3.--The Mexican Embassy at Washington late tonight delivered to THE NEW YORK TIMES the full text of the message which Alvaro Obregon. President of Mexico, presented yesterday to the Mexican Congress, in which he went thoroughly into...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3.--The Mexican Embassy at Washington late tonight delivered to THE NEW YORK TIMES the full text of the message which Alvaro Obregon. President of Mexico, presented yesterday to the Mexican Congress, in which he went thoroughly into the international situation and especially into the relations between Mexico and the united States.

headline.main: OBREGON'S MESSAGE SHOWS DEBT FEELER; Text of Address to Congress Reveals Invitation to Speyer and Co. for Conference. CONFIDENT OF RECOGNITION Professes Highest Regard for American Interests Despite His Rejection of Treaty.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: THE Macmillan list of Fall publications has appeared, a gay cover of goldenrod yellow, a hue well known on the stand  ard Macmillan jackets. The new edition of "The Outline of History" occupies the first page.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Macmillan list of Fall publications has appeared, a gay cover of goldenrod yellow, a hue well known on the stand ard Macmillan jackets. The new edition of "The Outline of History" occupies the first page.
